\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
The Euromod Connector for Python is built to facilitate and simplify the usage of the \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu}{EUROMOD} microsimulation model for research and analysis purposes.

\sphinxAtStartPar
EUROMOD is a tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit microsimulation model for the European Union that enables researchers and policy analysts to calculate, in a comparable manner, the effects of taxes and benefits on household incomes and work incentives for the population of each country and for the EU as a whole. It is a static microsimulation model that applies user\sphinxhyphen{}defined tax and benefit policy rules to harmonised microdata on individuals and households, calculates the effects of these rules on household income.


\chapter{Contents}
\label{\detokenize{index:contents}}
\sphinxstepscope


\section{Getting Started}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:getting-started}}\label{\detokenize{getstarted::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Euromod Conector is a Python library providing tools for running simulations and interacting with the tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit microsimulation model \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu}{EUROMOD}.


\subsection{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Euromod Connector can be installed from \sphinxhref{https://test.pypi.org/project/euromod/}{PyPi}  using \sphinxstyleemphasis{pip}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{}\PYG{+w}{ }pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }euromod
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsubsection{Requirements}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:requirements}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Euromod Connector requires two EUROMOD components: 1) the model (coded policy rules), and 2) the input microdata with the variables that respect the EUROMOD naming conventions.
For more information, please, read the sections “Model” and “Input microdata” on the \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu/download-euromod}{Download Euromod} web page.


\subsection{Load the model}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:load-the-model}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Import the EUROMOD model:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{euromod} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Model}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create an object of the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Model}} class by passing  the path to the  EUROMOD project:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{r}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZbs{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{EUROMOD\PYGZus{}RELEASES\PYGZus{}I6.0+}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{mod}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_output}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
Model located in C:\PYGZbs{}EUROMOD\PYGZus{}RELEASES\PYGZus{}I6.0+
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}

\subsection{Countries and systems}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:countries-and-systems}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Model.countries}} attirbute is a container storing the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Country}} objects which nest the country\sphinxhyphen{}specific tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit policies and systems.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Displays the EUROMOD default countries:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{countries}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_output}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

1: BE 
2: BG 
3: CY

\subsubsection{Datasets}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:datasets}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All the datasets that are available for a country\sphinxhyphen{}system model are collected in the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datasets}} as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Dataset}} objects.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Displaying information about a dataset relative to a country, e.g. dataset ‘sl\_demo\_v4’ for the country Simpleland, by indexing the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datasets}}:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{countries}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{SL}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{datasets}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}

\subsubsection{Policies}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:policies}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All the policies that apply in a country\sphinxhyphen{}system model are collected in the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{policies}} as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Policy}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.PolicyInSystem}} objects, respectively for the country and system objects.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Displaying all the policies modeled in a country using the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{policies}}:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}

\subsubsection{Functions}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:functions}}

The attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{functions}} stores all the functions defined in a country\sphinxhyphen{}system model as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Function}} objects and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.FunctionInSystem}} objects, respectively.

\subsubsection{Parameters}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:parameters}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{parameters}} is a container collecting all the policy\sphinxhyphen{}functions parameters of a given country\sphinxhyphen{}system model, respectively as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Parameter}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.ParameterInSystem}} objects.

\subsection{Run simulation}
\label{\detokenize{getstarted:run-simulation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The example below shows how to run a simulation on the EUROMOD’s Simpleland country model, which is an example of a simple country model provided by default with EUROMOD.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Load the EUROMOD model:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{euromod} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Model}
\PYG{n}{mod} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZbs{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{EUROMOD\PYGZus{}RELEASES\PYGZus{}I6.0+}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Get the best\sphinxhyphen{}match dataset for the system ‘SL\_1996’ in the country Simpleland ‘SL’:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{dataset\PYGZus{}id} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{countries}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{SL}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{systems}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{SL\PYGZus{}1996}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{bestmatch\PYGZus{}datasets}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{name}
\PYG{n}{dataset\PYGZus{}id}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_output}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZsq{}sl\PYGZus{}demo\PYGZus{}v4\PYGZsq{}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Load the Simpleland ‘SL’ dataset as a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pandas.DataFrame}}:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{pandas} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n+nn}{pd}
\PYG{n}{data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{pd}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{read\PYGZus{}csv}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{r}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZbs{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{EUROMOD\PYGZus{}RELEASES\PYGZus{}I6.0+}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZbs{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Input}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZbs{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{sl\PYGZus{}demo\PYGZus{}v4.txt}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{sep}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}t}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Run the simulation of the ‘SL’ system ‘SL\_1996’ using the dataset ‘sl\_demo\_v4’:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{out}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{countries}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{SL}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{systems}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{SL\PYGZus{}1996}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{sl\PYGZus{}demo\PYGZus{}v4}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_output}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
Simulation for system SL\PYGZus{}1996 with dataset sl\PYGZus{}demo\PYGZus{}v4 finished.
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The simulation run returns a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Simulation}} class that stores the results as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pandas.DataFrame}} objects in the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{outputs}}:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{out}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{outputs}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}

\subsection{\sphinxstylestrong{1. Run two systems with default parameters}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Simulation.configSettings}} is a  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{struct}} collecting the information about the system, dataset,  addons, extensions, and other configuration settings used in the simulation.


\subsection{\sphinxstylestrong{2. Run with changing constant}}
\label{\detokenize{example:run-with-changing-constant}}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The optional parameter \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{constantsToOverwrite}} specifies which constants to overwrite in the policy spline. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{constantsToOverwrite}} must be  a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}}, where the keys are \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuples}} of two \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} objects: the first string is the name of the constant and the second string is its group number (\sphinxstylestrong{Note:} Pass an empty string if the group number is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}}); the values are \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} with the new values of the constants. The default is None.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Simulation.constantsToOverwrite}} shows the modified constants used in the simulation:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{out}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{constantsToOverwrite}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_output}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZob{}(\PYGZsq{}\PYGZdl{}f\PYGZus{}h\PYGZus{}cpi\PYGZsq{}, \PYGZsq{}2022\PYGZsq{}): \PYGZsq{}10000\PYGZsq{}\PYGZcb{}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}

The optional parameter \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{addons}} is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu}{EUROMOD}  Addons to be integrated in the spine . Each item of the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} is   a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}} with two \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} objects. The first  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} is the name of the Addon and the second \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} is the name of the system in the Addon to be integrated (typically, it is the name of the Addon \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\_}} two\sphinxhyphen{}letter country code, e.g. LMA\_AT).  Available Addons are: LMA, MTR, NRR, TCA. The default is {[}{]}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The optional parameter \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{switches}} must define a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of the  \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu}{EUROMOD} extensions  to be switched on or off in the simulation. Each item in the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} is   a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}} with two objects. The first object is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} short name of the Extension. The second object is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}.  Available Extensions are: BTA, TCA, FYA, UAA, EPS, PBE, MWA, HHoT\_un, WEB, HHoT\_ext, HHoT\_ncp. The default is {[}{]}.

\sphinxstepscope


\section{User Guide}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:user-guide}}\label{\detokenize{userguide::doc}}

\subsection{What is the Euromod Conector?}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:what-is-the-euromod-conector}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Euromod Conector is a Python library providing tools for running simulations and interacting with the tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit microsimulation model \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu}{EUROMOD}.
The fundamental object of the Euromod Connector is the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Model}} class that nests the EUROMOD country\sphinxhyphen{}system models under the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{countries}}. Each country object is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Country}} class that collects in the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{systems}} attribute the country specific \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.System}} classes with the EUROMOD tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit systems. The country and system objects contain other various derived objects, such as datasets, policies, parameters, functions, extensions, and add\sphinxhyphen{}ons.
The simulation output is returned from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{run}} method as a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Simulation}} class.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Some indexing conventions apply:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The objects of the attributes \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{countries}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{systems}}, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simulations}} can be accessed using a single integer or a label. For the country object the label is a two\sphinxhyphen{}letter country name, for the system object it is the system’s name, for the simulation object it is the name of the simulation output dataset (Examples: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Model.countries{[}\textquotesingle{}PL\textquotesingle{}{]}, core.Model.countries{[}\textquotesingle{}PL\textquotesingle{}{]}.systems{[}\textquotesingle{}PL\_2020\textquotesingle{}{]}, core.Model.countries{[}3{]}, core.Model.countries{[}3{]}.systems{[}10{]}}}).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Country}} objects can be accessed directly from the model object, i.e. omitting the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{countries}} (Examples: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Model{[}\textquotesingle{}PL\textquotesingle{}{]}, core.Model{[}3{]}}} are equivalent to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Model.countries{[}3{]}}}).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.System}} objects can be accessed directly from the country object, i.e. omitting the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{systems}} (Examples: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Model{[}\textquotesingle{}PL\textquotesingle{}{]}{[}0{]}, core.Model{[}3{]}{[}\textquotesingle{}PL\_2005\textquotesingle{}{]}}} are equivalent to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Model.{[}\textquotesingle{}PL\textquotesingle{}{]}.systems{[}\textquotesingle{}PL\_2005\textquotesingle{}{]}}}).

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Note:} Modifying the objects in the Euromod Connector does not affect the EUROMOD original model, that is the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Model}} module everytime loads the original EUROMOD xml model files.
\end{quote}


\subsection{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Euromod Connector can be installed from \sphinxhref{https://test.pypi.org/project/euromod/}{PyPi}  using \sphinxstyleemphasis{pip}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{}\PYG{+w}{ }pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }euromod
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsubsection{Requirements}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:requirements}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Euromod Connector requires two \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu}{EUROMOD} components: 1) the model (coded policy rules) , and 2) the input microdata with the variables that respect the \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu}{EUROMOD} naming conventions.
For more information, please, read the sections “Model” and “Input microdata” on the \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu/download-euromod}{Download Euromod} web page.


\paragraph{Python version support}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:python-version-support}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Minimum Python version 3.8 required


\paragraph{Windows version support}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:windows-version-support}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Windows 64\sphinxhyphen{}bit


\subsubsection{Dependencies}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:dependencies}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Euromod Connector requires the following dependencies:


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\sphinxthistablewithglobalstyle

\sphinxbottomrule
\end{tabulary}
\sphinxtableafterendhook\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}


\subsubsection{Managing Errors}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:managing-errors}}

\paragraph{\sphinxstylestrong{1) ModuleNotFoundError} or \sphinxstylestrong{AttributeError}:}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:modulenotfounderror-or-attributeerror}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{import}} of the Euromod Connector libreries fails displaying one of the messages below:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+ne}{ModuleNotFoundError}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{No} \PYG{n}{module} \PYG{n}{named} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{System}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+ne}{AttributeError}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{module} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{clr}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{n}{has} \PYG{n}{no} \PYG{n}{attribute} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{AddReference}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
uninstall the Python \sphinxstyleemphasis{clr} package and re\sphinxhyphen{}install the \sphinxstyleemphasis{pythonnet} package:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{}\PYG{+w}{ }pip\PYG{+w}{ }uninstall\PYG{+w}{ }clr
\PYGZdl{}\PYG{+w}{ }pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }pythonnet
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This error is caused by a conflict between the Python \sphinxstyleemphasis{clr} package and the \sphinxstyleemphasis{clr} library of the \sphinxstyleemphasis{pythonnet} package.


\paragraph{\sphinxstylestrong{2) RuntimeError}:}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:runtimeerror}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If you encounter a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{RuntimeError}} as below, either 1) restart the kernel, or 2) open a new console window, or 3) deselect the option \sphinxstylestrong{User Module Reloader (UMR)} in the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Tools}}\sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Preferences}} \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Python Interpreter}} (or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Tools}} \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Console}} \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Advanced setting}}, depending on the Python editor version) then press \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Apply}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Ok}} and restart the consol windows.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Note:} Re\sphinxhyphen{}enabling the UMR option has no effect on the console windows that are already open.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This error is produced when Python reloads the libraries of the \sphinxstyleemphasis{pythonnet} package.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+ne}{RuntimeError}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Failed} \PYG{n}{to} \PYG{n}{initialize} \PYG{n}{Python}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Runtime}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{dll}

\PYG{n}{Failed} \PYG{n}{to} \PYG{n}{initialize} \PYG{n}{pythonnet}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{System}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{InvalidOperationException}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{This} \PYG{n+nb}{property} \PYG{n}{must} \PYG{n}{be} \PYG{n+nb}{set} \PYG{n}{before} \PYG{n}{runtime} \PYG{o+ow}{is} \PYG{n}{initialized}
   \PYG{n}{at} \PYG{n}{Python}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Runtime}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Runtime}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{set\PYGZus{}PythonDLL}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{String} \PYG{n}{value}\PYG{p}{)}
   \PYG{n}{at} \PYG{n}{Python}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Runtime}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Loader}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Initialize}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{IntPtr} \PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Int32} \PYG{n}{size}\PYG{p}{)}
   \PYG{n}{at} \PYG{n}{Python}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Runtime}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Runtime}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{set\PYGZus{}PythonDLL}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{String} \PYG{n}{value}\PYG{p}{)}
   \PYG{n}{at} \PYG{n}{Python}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Runtime}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Loader}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Initialize}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{IntPtr} \PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Int32} \PYG{n}{size}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Model}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:model}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Import the EUROMOD model:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{euromod} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Model}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create an object of the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Model}} class by passing the path to the  EUROMOD project:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{mod} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{r}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZbs{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{EUROMOD\PYGZus{}RELEASES\PYGZus{}I6.0+}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The model object \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{mod}} has two attributes: the EUROMOD \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{model\_path}} defined by the user, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{countries}} which instantiates the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Country}} classes for the EUROMOD default countries.

The attributes of the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Country}} class store the EUROMOD country\sphinxhyphen{}specific objects, such as the available datasets and systems, and the modelled policies and extensions. These objects contain other sub\sphinxhyphen{}classes with more specific information about the model.

The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.System}} attributes contain the specific system information such as the identifier, the best\sphinxhyphen{}match dataset(s),a comment, the currencies of the model parameters and of the simulation output, all the system\sphinxhyphen{}specific datasets of type \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.DatasetInSystem}} class,  the system’s name, order, access and the reference year. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{policies}} attribute collects the information about the system policies in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.PolicyInSystem}} classes.

\subsubsection{Policies}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:id3}}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
With respect to a country class, the policy objects in the system classes store additional information about the identifiers \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sysID}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{polID}} from, respectively, the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.System}} class and the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Policy}} class, the policy switch and the order number. The attributes \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{extensions}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{functions}} is a collection of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.FunctionInSystem}} classes.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The returned object is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.FunctionInSystem}} class with some default attributes, such as the name, identifier, extensions, and comment, a series of attributes for the reference identifiers (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{funID}} from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Function}} class, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{polID}} from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Policy}} class, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sysID}} from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.System}} class), the policy\sphinxhyphen{}function switch, and the order number. The attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{parameters}} stores additional modelling information of the system\sphinxhyphen{}specific parameters.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.ParameterInSystem}} object contains, additionally to the country object parameter, the order number, the related identifiers from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.System}} and the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Parameter}} objects, respectively \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sysID}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{parID}}, and the parameter \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{value}}.


\subsection{Find objects}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:find-objects}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The method \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{find}} allows searching for a string pattern in a class attribute of the Euromod Connector. It requires two input parameters: the name of the class attribute (the class name can also be specified using the dot notation), and a string pattern.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Find all the policies containing string ‘UPRATING’ in the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{comment}} in country Simpleland ‘SL’, setting parameter \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{case\_insentive}} to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{False}} (Note that the default is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}):

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{SL}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{policies}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{find}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{comment}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{UPRATING}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{case\PYGZus{}insentive}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_output}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
0: Uprate\PYGZus{}sl    |    DEF: UPRATING FACTORS 
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}

\end{sphinxuseclass}

\subsection{Run simulation}
\label{\detokenize{userguide:run-simulation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{run}} method to simulate the EUROMOD tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit systems by passing two required input arguments, a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pandas.DataFrame}} dataset and a name of the dataset. For a complete list of parameters please refere to the {[}API Reference User Guide{]}{[}{]}.
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Note:} The uprating factors are applied based on the dataset name.
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The example below shows how to run a simulation with default optional input parameters for Poland ‘PL’, tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit system ‘PL\_2022’, using the best match dataset as input data.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Geting the name of the best\sphinxhyphen{}match dataset for system ‘PL\_2022’:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{dataset\PYGZus{}id} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{PL}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{PL\PYGZus{}2022}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{bestmatch\PYGZus{}datasets}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{name}
\PYG{n}{dataset\PYGZus{}id}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_output}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZsq{}PL\PYGZus{}2020\PYGZus{}b2\PYGZsq{}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Load the data as a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pandas.DataFrame}} object:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{pandas} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n+nn}{pd}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{os}
\PYG{n}{dataset\PYGZus{}path} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{os}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{path}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{join}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZbs{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{EUROMOD\PYGZus{}RELEASES\PYGZus{}I6.0+}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZbs{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Input}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{dataset\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{.txt}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{pd}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{read\PYGZus{}csv}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{dataset\PYGZus{}path}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{sep}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}t}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Run the simulation providing two input parameters, a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pandas.DataFrame}} dataset and a name of the dataset:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{out}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{countries}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{PL}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{systems}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{PL\PYGZus{}2022}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{PL\PYGZus{}2020\PYGZus{}b2}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_output}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
Simulation for system PL\PYGZus{}2022 with dataset PL\PYGZus{}2020\PYGZus{}b2 finished.
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The simulation run returns a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.Simulation}} class that stores the results as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pandas.DataFrame}} objects in the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{outputs}}:

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_input}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{out}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{outputs}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{cell_output}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\section{API Reference}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/index:api-reference}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/index::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This reference documentation details the public objects of the Euromod Connector package. For a complete documentation please refer to the Euromod Connector User Guide.
For futher readings on the tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit microsimulation model EUROMOD please visit the official \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu/}{web\sphinxhyphen{}site}.  %
\begin{footnote}[1]\sphinxAtStartFootnote
Created with \sphinxhref{https://euromod-web.jrc.ec.europa.eu/}{Euromod web\sphinxhyphen{}site}
%
\end{footnote}

\sphinxstepscope

\subparagraph{Classes}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:classes}}\index{Country (class in euromod.core)@\spxentry{Country}\spxextra{class in euromod.core}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.Country}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{euromod.core.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Country}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{country}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{model}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{base.Euromod\_Element}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Country\sphinxhyphen{}specific EUROMOD tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit model.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class instantiates the EUROMOD tax benefit model for a given country.
A class instance is automatically generated and stored in the attribute
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{countries}} of the base class {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.Model}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Model}}}}}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class contains subclasses of type {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.System}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{System}}}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.Policy}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Policy}}}}},
{\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.Dataset}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dataset}}}}} and {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.Extension}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Extension}}}}}.
\subsubsection*{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{euromod} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Model}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{r}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZbs{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{EUROMOD\PYGZus{}RELEASES\PYGZus{}I6.0+}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{countries}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_data}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{ID\_DATASET}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{PATH\_DATA}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Load data as a \sphinxhref{https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.html\#pandas.DataFrame}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pandas.DataFrame}}} object.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ID\_DATASET}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}}) \textendash{} Name of the dataset excluding extension (Note: must be a \sphinxtitleref{txt} file).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{PATH\_DATA}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}}, optional) \textendash{} Path to the dataset. Default is the PATH\_TO\_EUROMOD\_PROJECT/Input folder.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Dataset is returned as a \sphinxhref{https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.html\#pandas.DataFrame}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pandas.DataFrame}}} object.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.html\#pandas.DataFrame}{pandas.DataFrame}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{Model (class in euromod.core)@\spxentry{Model}\spxextra{class in euromod.core}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.Model}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{euromod.core.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Model}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{model\_path}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{countries}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Base class of the Euromod Connector instantiating the microsimulation model
EUROMOD.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model\_path}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}}) \textendash{} Path to the EUROMOD project.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{countries}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}}, or \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#list}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}}} {[} \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}} {]}, optional) \textendash{} Countries to load from the project folder. Names must be two\sphinxhyphen{}letter
country codes, see the Eurostat \sphinxhref{https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php?title=Glossary:Country\_codes}{Glossary:Country codes}.
If omitted, will load all the available countries in the project folder.
Default is None.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A class containing the EUROMOD country models.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.Model}]{\sphinxcrossref{core.Model}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{System (class in euromod.core)@\spxentry{System}\spxextra{class in euromod.core}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.System}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{euromod.core.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{System}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{arg}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{base.Euromod\_Element}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A EUROMOD specific tax\sphinxhyphen{}benefit system.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class instantiates the EUROMOD tax benefit model for a specific system.
A class instance is automatically generated and stored in the attribute
\sphinxtitleref{systems} of class {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.Country}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Country}}}}}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class contains subclasses of type {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.DatasetInSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DatasetInSystem}}}}}, and
{\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/euromod/core/index:euromod.core.PolicyInSystem}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PolicyInSystem}}}}}.
\subsubsection*{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{mod}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{countries}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{systems}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}
